author: Hideyuki Sano
description: Japanese stocks are at risk of a prolonged decline after the upper house vote this Sunday, if pre-election polls are anything to go by.
title: Japan’s $6.8 Trillion Stock Market Faces Reckoning in Elections

author: Jef Feeley
description: Behind-the-scenes details of an agreement between Facebook and US privacy regulators in 2019 emerged in a Delaware court Wednesday, during a trial on investor claims the settlement cost them at least $7 billion.
title: Meta Trial on Privacy Scandal Begins With Tech, Politics A-List

author: Megan Howard
description: Bill Pulte, director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency, expressed confidence that a congressional panel will look into allegations surrounding Federal Reserve building renovations.
title: Pulte ‘Confident’ Congress Will Probe Powell Over Renovations

author: Zoe Tillman
description: Immigrant advocates are suing to stop what they allege is an unlawful effort by the Trump administration to ramp up arrests of migrants who appear at US immigration courts.
title: Trump Officials Face New Lawsuit Over Immigration Court Arrests

author: Arne Delfs, Ellen Milligan
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer and German Chancellor Friedrich Merz will sign a new Anglo-German treaty in London on Thursday that includes a commitment to assist each other in case of armed attack.
title: UK and Germany to Pledge to Defend Each Other in Reset of Ties

author: Akayla Gardner
description: The Department of Education is facing a reckoning under US President Donald Trump.
title: The Supreme Court Allowed Trump to Slash the Education Department. What Comes Next?

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: On Trumponomics, we discuss whether the administration’s race to loosen regulations, particularly on crypto, is setting the stage for another financial crisis.
title: Trump’s Financial Reforms: Needed Correction or Ticking Time Bomb?

author: Josh Wingrove
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House reporter Josh Wingrove looks at President Trump’s latest escalation against the Fed chief. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Toys With Firing Powell, Then Backpedals

author: Simone Iglesias
description: A US trade probe suddenly ordered by President Donald Trump on Brazil sent shockwaves through President Luiz Inacio da Silva’s government, according to a senior Brazilian diplomat who described it as an unwarranted threat that has helped to plunge relations to their lowest point in over a century.
title: US Probe Forcing Brazil to Negotiate at Gunpoint, Lula Aide Says

author: Catherine Larkin
description: President Donald Trump said in a Truth Social post that Coca-Cola Co. has agreed to use cane sugar in Coke beverages sold in the US.
title: Trump Says Coca-Cola Agrees to Use Cane Sugar for Coke in US

author: Katherine Doherty, Todd Gillespie
description: Top bosses at some of Wall Street’s biggest banks emphasized the importance of an independent Federal Reserve as the long-running saga between President Donald Trump and central bank Chair Jerome Powell intensified.
title: Wall Street CEOs Stress Fed Independence as Powell Attacks Grow

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Josh Wingrove, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump signed legislation that strengthens criminal penalties for fentanyl, hailing it as a “historic step toward justice” in his latest effort to address the public health crisis spurred by the deadly drug.
title: Trump Signs Bill to Toughen Penalties for Fentanyl Trafficking

author: Laura Nahmias, Amanda L Gordon
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams raised more than $1.5 million from donors in the seventeen days after the city’s Democratic mayoral primary, nearly double the amount brought in by Zohran Mamdani, whose stunning win reinvigorated the incumbent’s struggling campaign.
title: Adams’ Fundraising Doubles Mamdani’s Since Shock NYC Primary

author: Keith Laing
description: President Donald Trump’s choice to lead the nation’s top car safety regulator pledged to prioritize safety while at the same time making it easier for automakers to deploy-self driving cars.
title: Trump’s Auto Safety Pick Promises Rapid Self-Driving Deployment

author: Manuela Tobias
description: The relationship between Argentine leader Javier Milei and his No. 2 reached a breaking point after Vice President Victoria Villarruel imperiled the most important tenet of his economic program, a key lieutenant said.
title: Milei’s Rift With His Vice President Now ‘Undoubtedly a Crisis’

author: Faseeh Mangi, Sidhartha Shukla
description: Pakistan and El Salvador have established bilateral ties for the first time, putting cryptocurrency cooperation at the center of the relationship.
title: Pakistan, El Salvador Establish Bilateral Ties Based on Crypto

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The US Justice Department urged a federal judge to reject statements by El Salvador that appear to contradict Trump administration claims that the US government lacks legal authority over Venezuelan migrants it sent to a Salvadoran prison.
title: DOJ Disputes UN Report on Migrants US Sent to El Salvador Prison

author: Yash Roy
description: House Republican leaders struggled Wednesday to resolve an impasse with GOP hardliners on crypto legislation backed by President Donald Trump, holding open a key procedural vote as talks dragged on.
title: Trump ‘Crypto Week’ in Limbo Amid House Republican Impasse

author: Oliver Crook, Ott Ummelas
description: Norway is addressing “some real issues” in its trade talks with the US and still aims to prevent increases in tariffs, according to the country’s finance minister.
title: Norway, US Have a ‘Good Tone’ in Tariff Talks, Stoltenberg Says

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump lashed out at fellow Republicans who have been calling for his administration to release documents related to disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, casting the files as a distraction spun up by Democrats to undermine his agenda.
title: Trump Calls Allies Demanding Epstein Files ‘Stupid People’

author: Kate Sullivan
description: Bahrain’s Crown Prince Salman bin Hamad Al Khalifa pledged $17 billion worth of investments in the US as he met with President Donald Trump at the White House.
title: Bahrain’s PM Vows $17 Billion US Investment During Trump Meeting

author: Josh Wingrove, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said he would send letters to more than 150 countries notifying them of tariff rates as he pushes ahead with a trade agenda that has sent US partners racing to avoid higher import taxes.
title: Trump Says He’ll Send Tariff Letters to More Than 150 Countries

author: Josh Wingrove, Annmarie Hordern, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said he “not planning on doing anything” to remove Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, after floating the idea in a closed-door meeting with congressional Republicans that leaked to the media.
title: Trump Now Says Firing Powell ‘Unlikely,’ Whipsawing Markets

author: Josh Wingrove, Annmarie Hordern
description: President Donald Trump said he is “not planning on doing anything” to remove Jerome Powell, after a White House official said the president was likely to seek the Federal Reserve Chair’s ouster soon.
title: Trump Says Firing Fed Chair Powell ‘Highly Unlikely’

author: Galit Altstein
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition has lost its ruling majority after a second ultra-Orthodox party quit the government over a bill watering down a decades-long religious exemption from military service.
title: Netanyahu’s Coalition Loses Majority on Feud Over Military Draft

author: Myles Miller, Ava Benny-Morrison
description: New York’s former interim police commissioner sued Mayor Eric Adams, accusing him of engaging in systemic corruption and using the police department to consolidate political power.
title: Ex-NYPD Commissioner Sues Adams Over ‘Systemic Corruption’

author: Lucy White, Ailbhe Rea
description: Labour suspended four of its Members of Parliament for breaking party discipline following a large-scale rebellion over welfare cuts earlier this month.
title: Labour Suspends UK MPs Who Led Welfare Reforms Rebellion

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump is likely to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell soon, a White House official said, and discussed the possible move in a meeting with congressional Republicans on Tuesday night.
title: Trump Likely to Fire Powell Soon, White House Official Says

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Quad countries, comprising of the US, Australia, Japan and India, discussed securing and expanding underwater communication cables amid a rising threat of sabotage and cyber attacks, the US embassy in India said in a statement.
title: Quad Countries Discuss Submarine Cable Security as Threats Rise

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: The European Central Bank should reduce borrowing costs to help the economy by weakening the single currency, Italian Deputy Premier Antonio Tajani said.
title: ECB Should Cut Rates to Weaken Euro, Italy’s Deputy Premier Says

author: Jim Wyss
description: Cuba’s labor minister resigned days after she went viral for claiming the island’s beggars and garbage scavengers weren’t truly poor, but rather trying to bilk the communist regime.
title: Cuban Minister Quits After Scoffing at Communist Island’s Poor

author: Jenny Leonard, Mackenzie Hawkins
description: President Donald Trump has dialed down his confrontational tone with China in an effort to secure a summit with counterpart Xi Jinping and a trade deal with the world’s second-largest economy, people familiar with internal deliberations said.
title: Trump Softens Tone on China to Secure Xi Summit and a Trade Deal

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Swiss officials approved the draft of a framework trade deal with the US almost two weeks ago, and are continuing talks while awaiting sign off from President Donald Trump, according to the government.
title: Swiss Trade Deal With US Is Awaiting Trump’s Sign Off, Bern Says

author: Sabrina Nelson Garcinuno, Ainhoa Goyeneche
description: The number of homes for sale on Spain’s main real estate listings website fell by 20% in the second quarter, the biggest drop since at least 2007 and a sign of the challenge the country faces to address its housing crunch.
title: Spain Housing Supply Plunges 20% During Quarter as Prices Soar

author: Sara Gharaibeh
description: Twenty people were killed Wednesday at an aid distribution site run by an Israeli and US-backed organization, while talks for a ceasefire in Gaza make little headway.
title: Gaza Aid-Site Stampede Leaves 20 People Dead at Khan Younis Hub

author: Ellen Milligan
description: UK Foreign Secretary David Lammy suggested he’s considering imposing sanctions on Israel’s defense minister over his proposal to move Palestinians in Gaza to a “humanitarian city” in Rafah, in the latest sign of growing tensions between European governments and Benjamin Netanyahu’s administration.
title: UK Weighs Sanctions Over Israel’s ‘Humanitarian City’ Proposal

author: Kamil Kowalcze, William Horobin
description: German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil said the government in Berlin stands by its commitment to a global minimum corporate tax, clarifying remarks by Chancellor Friedrich Merz that appeared to call Berlin’s support for the levy into question.
title: German Finance Chief Says Berlin Committed to Global Company Tax

author: Tom Maloney
description: A batch of Trump memecoins set to be unlocked this week will test demand for the cryptocurrency and add almost $100 million to the billionaire president’s net worth.
title: Unlocked Trump Memecoins Will Test Crypto Demand While Boosting His Wealth

author: Jorge Valero, Lyubov Pronina, Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Union has proposed a budget of close to €2 trillion ($2.3 trillion) for its next seven year budget, as it seeks to fend off a range of challenges from rising global economic competition to increased defense demands.
title: EU Proposes Draft Budget Close to €2 Trillion for 2028-2034

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Madison Muller
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s chief of staff Heather Flick Melanson departed after six months in the role, according to people familiar with the matter. Kennedy has appointed Matt Buckham as acting chief of staff effective immediately.
title: RFK Jr. Replaces Chief of Staff in Shakeup at Top US Health Agency

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: Thailand’s finance minister will present fresh proposals to US trade officials in talks scheduled for Wednesday, the latest effort by the nation to avoid a 36% tariff threatened by President Donald Trump.
title: Thailand to Make Fresh Proposals to US in Bid to Avert Tariff

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkey’s most popular opposition politician Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu was sentenced to nearly two years in prison on Wednesday, after a court found him guilty of “threatening” Istanbul’s chief prosecutor.
title: Turkey Sentences Erdogan Rival to Prison for Prosecutor Threats

author: Henrique Almeida, Joao Lima
description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro plans to replace central bank Governor Mario Centeno after his first term ends July 19, according to a person familiar with the premier’s thinking.
title: Portugal Is Set to Replace Centeno as Central Bank Governor

author: Shruti Srivastava, Ruchi Bhatia, Anup Roy
description: Indian officials are hoping to secure a trade deal with US President Donald Trump at a lower tariff rate than he’d agreed with Indonesia as New Delhi races to meet an Aug. 1 deadline.
title: India Seeks Lower Tariff Than Indonesia in Race to Clinch Deal

author: Monique Vanek
description: Three months after South Africa appointed Mcebisi Jonas as a special envoy to the US and tasked him with helping reset bilateral relations with President Donald Trump’s administration, he has yet to visit the nation or meet with any high-level officials.
title: South Africa Envoy Sidelined in Talks to Reset Relations With US

author: Galit Altstein, Kateryna Kadabashy
description: Israel intensified its attacks on Syria, striking the country’s military headquarters in Damascus around midday on Wednesday.
title: Israel Steps Up Syria Strikes and Hits Military Headquarters

author: Dan Strumpf
description: New Delhi is banking on an agreement that allows it to dodge punitive US tariffs.
title: India Is Getting Squeezed Between the US and China

author: Mark Schroers
description: Germany’s economy probably failed to grow in the second quarter after a surprisingly strong expansion at the start of the year, according to Bundesbank.
title: Germany’s Economy Likely Stagnated in Second Quarter, Bundesbank Says

author: Alice Atkins
description: Angst around how France will control its swelling budget deficit is returning to financial markets and may start to dent demand for the euro, according to strategists at ING Groep NV.
title: French Budget Is a ‘Ticking Bomb’ for Euro, ING’s Pesole Says

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero
description: A growing number of European Union member states want the bloc to activate its most powerful trade tool against the US should the two sides fail to reach an acceptable agreement by Aug. 1 and Donald Trump carries out his threat of 30% tariffs on the US’s largest trading partner.
title: France Builds Support for Using Most-Potent EU Trade Tool on US

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: A Thai criminal court is set to rule next month on a near decade-old royal defamation case against former premier Thaksin Shinawatra, raising fresh risks for the head of the embattled political dynasty that controls the country’s ruling party.
title: Thai Court to Rule in August on Royal Insult Case Against Thaksin Amid Political Crisis

author: Samuel Stolton, Gaspard Sebag
description: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen and her two sisters lost a fight against a European Parliament order for their late father Jean-Marie to give back more than €300,000 ($349,000) in misused funds during his time as a member of the assembly.
title: Le Pens Face €300,000 Bill Over Father’s Costs After EU Loss

author: Yian Lee, Jenny Leonard
description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te intends to make two stops in the US as part of a trip to diplomatic allies, testing ties between Beijing and Washington just as they prepare for a possible leaders’ summit.
title: Taiwan President Plans US Stops, Testing Washington-Beijing Ties

author: Chandra Asmara, Eddie Spence, Claire Jiao
description: Indonesia’s president said he struck a 19% tariff deal with US President Donald Trump, the first confirmation of the key agreement detail after months of talks between the countries.
title: Prabowo Confirms US to Impose 19% Tariff on Indonesian Goods

author: Wes Kosova
description: US allies look to bulk up their arsenals with European-made weapons instead of buying American.
title: Europe’s Arms Makers Get a Boost From Trump’s NATO Demands

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkey’s most popular opposition politician, Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, appeared in court in a case that could end his career.
title: Turkey’s Popular Mayor Faces Political Ban in Latest Trial

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Russia launched a massive drone attack on Ukraine’s central regions overnight, hitting mostly civilian infrastructure and industrial enterprises.
title: Russia Attacks Ukraine’s Central Regions as US Envoy in Kyiv

author: Alan Katz
description: French Finance Minister Eric Lombard said he’s confident the government will be able to get the 2026 budget approved in parliament and is open to improving the plan through discussions with opposition parties.
title: France’s Lombard Says Will ‘Improve’ Budget in Opposition Talks

author: Andrey Biryukov
description: Uzbekistan is aiming to raise $300 million from the sale of a leading mobile operator, seeking to draw interest from Middle Eastern and European investors, according to two people familiar with the details of the plans.
title: Uzbekistan Seeks $300 Million in Mobile Operator Sale

author: Elffie Chew, Julia Fioretti
description: Malaysia’s sovereign wealth fund is weighing raising $500 million from an exchangeable dollar bond sale to help fund its overseas investments, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Khazanah Is Said to Consider $500 Million Exchangeable Bond Sale

author: Zahra Hirji
description: Arizona Democrat Yassamin Ansari told attendees of Bloomberg Green Seattle that focusing on the rising costs of energy will resonate with voters.
title: Democrats’ Path to Power Is ‘Climate Populism’, US Representative Says

author: Lionel Laurent
description: Things are bad when US bank bosses are the ones pushing Europe to toughen up.
title: US Tariffs at 30%? C'mon, Europe... Do Something

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: The US is planning to build a boat maintenance facility at a Philippine naval detachment near the disputed South China Sea.
title: US Plans to Build Boat Repair Facility Near South China Sea

author: Prima Wirayani, Eduard Gismatullin, Matthew Burgess
description: Indonesian assets will get a boost from a positive sentiment stemming from a trade deal reached with the US, according to analysts.
title: US Trade Deals May Boost Indonesia Assets in Near Term: Analysts

author: Grace Sihombing
description: The Indonesian trade deal announced by US President Donald Trump provides some clarity for the nation’s economy, although the lack of details will likely keep its central bank cautious at its monetary policy meeting Wednesday.
title: Surprise Trump Trade Deal to Weigh on Indonesia Rate Decision

author: Robert Burnson
description: The Trump administration sued three Corporation for Public Broadcasting directors for allegedly refusing to leave their posts after he fired them in April and they lost a preliminary legal challenge to their dismissals.
title: Trump Sues to Oust Public Broadcasting Directors He Already Axed

author: Erik Wasson
description: Public broadcasting and a swath of foreign aid programs are on track to lose federal funding after the Senate voted to advance a $9.4 billion package of cuts on a 51 to 50 vote, with Vice President JD Vance breaking a tie.
title: Trump’s Cuts to Public Broadcasting and Foreign Aid Clear Key Vote

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: The Trump administration has recalled about half of the California National Guard troops that were deployed to Los Angeles under federal orders last month after a series of high-profile immigration raids and anti-deportation protests.
title: Trump Administration Pulls Back Deployment of National Guard in LA

author: Catherine Lucey, Myles Miller
description: The rift within the Republican Party over the release of documents related to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein continued to widen, with top congressional allies of President Donald Trump — including House Speaker Mike Johnson — calling for his administration to exercise greater transparency.
title: Trump Team’s Handling of Epstein Files Deepens Republican Divide
